title: Web Hacking Pro Tips
originalTitle: Web Hacking Pro Tips #18: @tomnomnom Tom Hudson
description: A chat with the wonderful Pete Yaworski about life and hacking.

title: NahamCon2024: Sluicing Scripts
originalTitle: #NahamCon2024: Sluicing Scripts | @TomNomNomDotCom@TomNomNomDotCom
description: A talk about using jsluice to extract interesting bits from JavaScript files by running tree-sitter queries.

title: JSluice: There's Gold In Them Thar Files
originalTitle: JSluice: There's Gold In Them Thar Files by Tomnomnom
description: The talk in which I announced jsluice, a tool for finding URLs, secrets, and other interesting things in JavaScript.

title: Passive-ish Recon Techniques
originalTitle: Passive-ish Recon Techniques by Tom Hudson
description: I think this was my first security talk. I talked about meg for the first time, and the ideas that led to its development.

title: Hey!: Let's build a virtual machine!
originalTitle: Hey!: Tom Hudson - Let's build a virtual machine!
description: Live-coding can be risky, but it worked out OK this time. Writing a simple language VM in Go live on stage.

title: Hacker101 - JavaScript for Hackers (with @STOKfredrik)
originalTitle: Hacker101 - JavaScript for Hackers (Created by @STOKfredrik)
description: A video I worked on with STÖK for HackerOne. An intro to using Chrome's DevTools to explore web applications.

title: Writing Readable Code
originalTitle: Tom Hudson - Writing Readable Code
description: I've spent a lot of time reading code, and I developed a list of things that bug me along the way and then did a talk about it.

title: NahamCon2022EU: Command-Line Data-Wrangling
originalTitle: #NahamCon2022EU: Command-Line Data-Wrangling by Tomnomnom
description: I spend a lot of time trying to get text from one format to another, so I did a talk about how to do that on the command-line.

title: Live Recon and Automation on Shopify's Bug Bounty Program with @TomNomNomDotCom
originalTitle: Live Recon and Automation on Shopify's Bug Bounty Program with @TomNomNomDotCom
description: Doing some basic recon with NahamSec on Twitch.

title: NahamCon2020: Who, What, Where, When, Wordlist
originalTitle: Who, What, Where, When, Wordlist by @TomNomNom #NahamCon2020
description: Wordlists are a big part of web hacking, and having the same lists as everybody else limits what you can find, so I did a talk about making your own.

title: InfoSec Journeys
originalTitle: InfoSec Journeys #8 - TomNomNom
description: A chat with Colin Hardy and Ashley Pierre about how I got started in bug bounty, writing tools, and that sort of thing.

title: VIM tutorial: linux terminal tools for bug bounty pentest and redteams with @tomnomnom
originalTitle: VIM tutorial: linux terminal tools for bug bounty pentest and redteams with @tomnomnom
description: STÖK asked me to show him my tools and workflows, so I did. Unscripted, but highly subject to skillful editing.

title: Live Bug Bounty Recon Session on Yahoo (meg, assetfinder, etc)
originalTitle: 09/29/2019 - Live Bug Bounty Recon Session on Yahoo (meg, assetfinder, etc) w/ @Tomnomnom
description: Demonstrating some tools and recon techniques live with NahamSec on Twitch.

title: Hacker Heroes
originalTitle: Hacker Heroes #3 - @TomNomNom (Interview)
description: An interview with PascalSec for Intigriti about when to write tools, the UK hacker scene and that kind of thing.

title: Big Numbers and the 1Hz CPU
originalTitle: Big Numbers and the 1Hz CPU with Tom Hudson
description: A lightning talk about just how incredibly fast computers are.

originalTitle: TomNomNom Discord AMA
description: A fun Ask Me Anything session with my employer.

originalTitle: Bug Bounties With Bash - VirSecCon2020 Talk

title: Networking Fundamentals
originalTitle: Networking Fundamentals
description: Networking for people who already kind of know a bit about computers.

title: NahamCon2021 - Using Chromedp to Hunt for Prototype Pollution - @TomNomNomDotCom
originalTitle: NahamCon2021 - Using Chromedp to Hunt for Prototype Pollution - @TomNomNomDotCom
description: Client-side bugs are kind of a pain to look for at scale, so I did a talk about how to do that.

title: The Find Command
originalTitle: The Find Command
description: The find command has a reputation for being difficult to use, so I made a short video about it.

title: Xargs Explained
originalTitle: Xargs Explained
description: I use xargs quite often, especially in conjunction with the find command, so I made a short video on how to use it.

title: Confessions of a Toolmaker
originalTitle: Confessions of a Toolmaker - Tom Hudson (tomnomnom) - Ekoparty 2024
